instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00164 No Green Light.
threads.message:
No water damage found at all.
PPBUS 3v42 is present with no short.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00164 No Green Light.
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H and PP3V42_G3H are separate. Which one is present with no short?

Is PPBUS_G3H 8.16v or 8.5v?

Is SMC_RESET_L 3.3v, 0.5v, or 0v?

Is PP3V42_G3H present at the dc in board connector? 

Is the flat cable between the dc in board and dc in cable in good condition?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00164 No Green Light.
threads.message:
Is PPBUS_G3H 8.16v or 8.5v? 8.15v

Is SMC_RESET_L 3.3v, 0.5v, or 0v? R5100 reading is pin 2 0.001 pin 1 3.13v resistor might be shot also just noticed u5110 looks like garbage corroded


Is PP3V42_G3H present at the dc in board connector?  yes


Is the flat cable between the dc in board and dc in cable in good condition? looks good but red dot is red

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00164 No Green Light.
threads.message: You have an SMC reset issue. Replace U5110 and R5100 and clean the crap up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00164 No Green Light.
threads.message: Done. We get a fan spin. now. Pads were ripped under the u5110 is there a technique that can be used here to replace these pads when you have chips with no legs. I used a wire from cleaning wick and it worked but is there something more solid that can be done. ? cause the chip was kind of uneven.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00164 No Green Light.
threads.message: Nope, just use some fine wire. You can mash it flat a little bit more, but that is just how you do this.
